questions.stem_text: A right triangle has legs of lengths 5 and 12. The hypotenuse is:
questions.answer_explanation: Using the Pythagorean theorem, the hypotenuse is calculated as √(5² + 12²) = 13.
questions.original_text:
5. A right triangle has legs of lengths 5 and 12. The hypotenuse is:
(a) 11
(b) 12
(c) 13
(d) 14

questions.answer_explanation: Zero is considered neutral, as it is neither positive nor negative.
questions.original_text: 7. The number 0 is neither positive nor negative.

questions.stem_text: The product of two even numbers is even.
questions.answer_explanation: Multiplying two even numbers always results in an even number.
questions.original_text: 8. The product of two even numbers is even.

questions.stem_text: The perimeter of a square with side 7 units is 28 units.
questions.answer_explanation: The perimeter of a square is calculated as 4 times the side length. Therefore, 4 × 7 = 28.

formulas.description: Formula for the perimeter of a square

questions.original_text: 9. The perimeter of a square with side 7 units is 28 units.

questions.answer_explanation: First, divide 36 by 3 to get 12. Then, multiply 5 by 4 to get 20. Finally, add 12 and 20 to get 32.
First, divide 36 by 3 to get 12, then multiply 5 by 4 to get 20, and finally add the results: 12 + 20 = 32.

questions.stem_text: Simplify the fraction: 45/60 (write in lowest terms).
questions.answer_explanation: Divide both the numerator and the denominator by their greatest common divisor, which is 15.
questions.original_text: 12. Simplify the fraction: 45/60 (write in lowest terms). (4 marks)

questions.answer_explanation: Add 9 to both sides to get 5x = 25, then divide by 5.

questions.stem_text: Find the simple interest on $800 at 5% per year for 3 years.
questions.answer_explanation: Use the formula I = PRT, where P = 800, R = 0.05, T = 3.
questions.original_text: 14. Find the simple interest on $800 at 5% per year for 3 years. (4 marks)

questions.stem_text: A pen marked at $50 is sold at a 20% discount. Find the selling price.
questions.answer_explanation: The selling price is calculated by applying a 20% discount to the marked price of $50. 20% of $50 is $10, so the selling price is $50 - $10 = $40.

formulas.text: Selling Price = Marked Price - (Discount Percentage × Marked Price)
formulas.description: Formula to calculate selling price after discount

questions.original_text: 15. A pen marked at $ 50 is sold at a 20% discount. Find the selling price. (8 marks)
